txt.en: The Stag-clan of Lhan Tarren welcomes you
Elain is thrilled that you have come to stay at Lhan Tarren
The Elder is filled with gratitude for your rescue of his clan's huntress
You have passed very recently into the land of Dunland.

'Hail, Duvodiad. Will you stay a moment? We have need of a strong warrior like yourself in our little band.

'We can find work for you and reward as well, for there is much to be done, and even more to be gained....'

<rgb=#FF0000>WARNING: This is a solo instance and cannot be completed in a fellowship.</rgb>
You should speak with the look-out in the northern pass of Trum Dreng.

'Ah! You must be [placeholder]! Come, come. Make yourself at home. I like the look of you, [placeholder]! A good, strong, sturdy [placeholder] -- that is what I like in a warrior.\n\n'You have done us a great service by rescuing our headstrong little huntress. Elain is a brash girl... but we would be helpless without her!'

Lhan Tarren, the village of Elain of the Stag-clan, lies to the south of where you found her.\n\nYou have been urged to seek the hospitality of the humble Caru-l√ªth clansmen while you pass through Trum Dreng.
Elain made it safely back to her village, Lhan Tarren.\n\nYou should speak with Elain briefly before presenting yourself to the Elder of the Stag-clan in Trum Dreng.

'You are willing to join us, then? Good, consider it done. You are one of our small clan now. We are not so different; we all want the same things: wealth, power. Run with us, and you shall have both! Of this, we have been assured.'

'Hold, Duvodiad. Let me have a look at you.

'Ah, you are the kind [placeholder] of whom Elain spoke! We have been expecting you. You have our gratitude and our hospitality.

'We do not make a habit of welcoming outsiders into our midst, but exceptions are to be made for a hero. Come... there are many who wish to thank you, and most of all the Elder. He can be found within.'
The Elder of Lhan Tarren is inside the bounds of the village.\n\nYou should speak with the Elder, for he wishes to thank you for your kindness to Elain.

'I knew you would come, [placeholder]! I hope Cadelh did not give you any trouble on the bridge -- my people are suspicious of duvodiad, but I told them about how you rescued me from the outcasts.\n\n'The Elder wishes to speak with you, my friend. He means to give you a proper welcome.'
Talk to the look-out to join the Dunlendings of Trum Dreng
Find the village of Lhan Tarren
Talk to the Elder of the Stag-clan
